A transparent overlay for gesture input that can be placed on top of other widgets or contain other widgets. More...

Private Member Functions

 DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN (GestureController)

Detailed Description

A transparent overlay for gesture input that can be placed on top of other widgets or contain other widgets. 

 // Assume that we have a GestureController pointer named "mpView"
 // Create a instance of GestureController
 mpView = new GestureController(static_cast<Page*>(this));

 // Assume that we have a OnGestureListener pointer named "mpListener"
 // Add that listener to this overlay
 mpView->addOnGestureListener(mpListener);

 // Get the color we used to draw a gesture
 int32_t color = mpView->getGestureColor();

 // Cancel the gesturing
 mpView->cancelGesture();

Definition at line 49 of file GestureController.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum
Enumerator:
GESTURE_STROKE_TYPE_SINGLE 

A gesture is made of only one stroke.

GESTURE_STROKE_TYPE_MULTIPLE 

A gesture is made of multiple strokes.

ORIENTATION_HORIZONTAL 

Defines an horizontal weidget.

ORIENTATION_VERTICAL 

Defines a vertical widget.

gaia::core::GestureController::GestureController ( Context *  context,
AttributeSet *  attrs,
bool  extension = 0 
)

Constructor that is called when inflating from XML.

This is called when a GestureController is being constructed from an XML file, supplying attributes that were specified in the XML file.

Parameters:
contextThe Context the Widget is running in, through which it can access the current resources, etc.
attrsThe attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the Widget.
extensiontrue if you wnat to customize, default is false

int32_t gaia::core::GestureController::getOrientation ( ) const

Get whether horizontal (when the orientation is vertical) or vertical (when orientation is horizontal) strokes automatically define a gesture.


Return value must be one of the following constant values.
ORIENTATION_HORIZONTAL - Defines an horizontal weidget.
ORIENTATION_VERTICAL - Defines a vertical widget.
